pull.title: descriptors: Try pubkeys of both evenness when retrieving the private keys for an xonly pubkey in a descriptor
pull.body:
When a `ConstPubkeyProvider` is xonly, the stored pubkey does not necessarily have the correct evenness. `ToPrivateString()` is correctly handling this by looking up the keys for both evenness bits, but `GetPrivKey` does not. This results in not finding the private key when it is actually available if its pubkey is the other evenness.

To fix this, this key finding is refactored into `GetPrivKey()` so that its behavior is corrected, and `ToPrivateString()` is changed to use `GetPrivKey()` as well.

Additionally, the descriptor test checks are updated to include a check for `ExpandPrivate()` to verify that both the parsed public and private descriptors produce `SigningProvider`s with the same contents.

Fixes #31589

events.message:
descriptor: Try the other evenness in ConstPubkeyProvider::GetPrivKey()

GetPrivKey() needs the same handling of all keyids for xonly keys that
ToPrivateString() does. Refactor that into GetPrivKey() and reuse it in
ToPrivateString() to resolve this.
tests: Check ExpandPrivate matches for both parsed descriptors

looking good, only left few nits. No need to tackle them. Will test it properly in the coming days.

Concept and code-review ACK 116ed1d543641006f74bf089c23714259b6d4904

commit message / PR description micro-nit: haven't seen the term "evenness" before in this context, I think we usually call it "parity bit" (as in [BIP-341](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0341.mediawiki#cite_note-10))

q: why not store the id belonging to the pubkey with the correct parity bit inside the `SigningProvider` arg at the point where such a structure is loaded? (which most likely happens inside `ParsePubkeyInner()`).

> q: why not store the id belonging to the pubkey with the correct parity bit inside the `SigningProvider` arg at the point where such a structure is loaded? (which most likely happens inside `ParsePubkeyInner()`).

The pubkey in the descriptor has no parity bit information at all, and parsing is context independent.
